item.title: Meet Our Newest Innovators: Welcoming AI4SE Interns as JetBrains Employees!
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Exciting times at JetBrains as we welcome our new AI4SE interns! These recent graduates from TU Delft have transitioned from academic projects to full-time roles, applying their MSc thesis work in real-world settings. Meet Milan, Nadine, Saga, and Sergey, who gained hands-on experience during their internships and contributed to significant research. Their work will soon lead to journal publications! üìö The AI4SE program, launched in 2023, combines academic research with industry‚Ä¶

Source: JetBrains Blog
Author: Katie Fraser
Category: event

item.title: ICPC World Finals Livestream: ecnerwala and SecondThread Speed-Solving Kotlin Challenge

item.title: Hack Week 2025: How these engineers liquid-cooled a GPU server
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Hack Week 2025 at Dropbox focused on the theme ‚ÄúKeep It Simple,‚Äù encouraging innovation and collaboration. One highlight was the ‚ÄúLiquid Cooling CPU/GPU Hardware‚Äù project, which won the Learn Fast award. The team developed a custom liquid cooling system for GPU servers to address the thermal demands of AI workloads. This system demonstrated significant benefits, including lower operating temperatures and quieter performance. Future plans include expanding testing across multiple data‚Ä¶

Source: Dropbox Tech Blog
Author: Catie Keck
Category: event

item.title: Living My Childhood Dream ‚Äî Thanks to Cisco‚Äôs Time2Give Benefit

Rana K., a Technical Consulting Engineer at Cisco, shares her inspiring journey of fulfilling a childhood dream through the company‚Äôs Time2Give benefit. üåç‚ú® This initiative allows employees to dedicate 80 hours annually to volunteer for causes they care about. Rana, originally from Egypt and now living in Poland, has embraced this opportunity to teach and give back globally. She reflects on the connections she‚Äôs made, highlighting that cultural differences have not hindered her ability to‚Ä¶

item.title: Cloudflare Launching AI Miniseries for Developers (and Everyone Else They Know)
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Cloudflare has launched ‚ÄúAI Avenue,‚Äù a miniseries designed to demystify AI for developers and the general public. Each episode explores AI‚Äôs growth, capabilities, and human augmentation stories, making the technology approachable and engaging. Viewers can interact with AI hands-on, breaking down fears and showcasing its potential. Join the journey to learn more at aiavenue.show! #AI #Cloudflare #Innovation #Technology #HumanAugmentation

Source: Cloudflare Blog
Author: Craig Dennis
Category: event

item.title: Kotlin on the Backend ‚Äì What‚Äôs New From KotlinConf 2025
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
KotlinConf 2025 showcased significant advancements in server-side Kotlin. üåê Key highlights include a strategic partnership with Spring for enhanced null-safety and Kotlin-centric tutorials. üìö Developers are increasingly adopting Kotlin for backend, with notable insights shared by leaders from major tech companies. Ktor continues to evolve, offering support for modern scalable applications, including new features for dependency injection and server-driven UI development. For in-depth insights,‚Ä¶

Source: JetBrains Blog
Author: Alina Dolgikh
Category: event
